description: Moving the draw point, and drawing lines
The CanvasRenderingContext2D interface allows you to draw on the canvas element.
The width and height attributes of the canvas element indicate the range of the x and y value.
The top left corner of the canvas is at x=0, y=0, and the lower right corner is at x=1000, y=1000 in our case,
because the width is 1000, and the height is also 1000.
You always need to start with a call to the beginPath method, and end with a call to the stroke method.
To move the draw point, call the moveTo method.
x: The horizontal distance to the rigth of the left border of the canvas.
y: The vertical distance down from the top border of the canvas.
To make a line from the current draw point to another position, call the lineTo method.
x: The horizontal distance to the rigth of the left border of the canvas.
y: The vertical distance down from the top border of the canvas.
To draw the path that you have defined since beginPath, call the stroke method.
Make the canvas on the right marked Assignment look the same as the canvas on the left marked Solution.
Use the moveTo method to move the draw point to x=500, y=500.
Use the lineTo method to draw a line from that point to x=400, y=400.
Write your code in the editor box, and click the Run button to execute it.
You can move the whole coordinate system around by using the translate method.
x: The horizontal distance to the rigth of the left border of the canvas.
y: The vertical distance down from the top border of the canvas.
If you want to translate the canvas, and go back to the previous state afterwards, you can use the save method before
and the restore method after. In that way the canvas is back to the original state.
Please note that it is the coordinate system that moves, and not the canvas. Therefore you must call translate before any moveTo or lineTo

description: You can rotate the whole coordinate system by using the rotate method.
angle: The angle to rotate measured in radians.
The coordinate system is rotated clockwise, and the point of rotation is x=0, y=0.
So if you want to rotate in the center of the canvas, you need to translate first.
The angle is measured in radians. Radians is the length you travel on the circumference for the angle in a circle where radius is 1.

description: You can write text in the canvas using the fillText or strokeText method.
text: The string you want to draw.
x: The horizontal distance to the right of the current 0, 0 point in the canvas.
y: The vertical distance down from the current 0, 0 point in the canvas.
maxWidth: The maximum width of the text
The text is drawn relative to the current 0, 0 point. Remember, we might have translated the coordinate system.
If maxWidth is specified, the text will be truncated or cut off if the width of the text is bigger than maxWidth.
If the optional argument maxWidth is not specified, the text will be drawn in full.
You can change the font (the way the text looks) and the size by setting the font property of the context.
The font property must be written just like a CSS font property.

Draw the polygon with a call to the stroke method.
